examples: This second stage started in 2014 with the accession of Crimea.

words.defineVi: tạo một bản ghi bổ sung cho một bộ sưu tập, chẳng hạn như một thư viện

examples: Her fashion sense is very old school, with vintage dresses and retro accessories.

words.defineEn: furnishing added support
words.defineVi: cung cấp thêm hỗ trợ

examples: But skeptics wondered what other cuts would be needed.

words.defineEn: an individual who regularly questions and doubts the validity of ideas and beliefs, particularly those that are commonly accepted
words.defineVi: một cá nhân thường xuyên đặt câu hỏi và nghi ngờ tính hợp lệ của các ý tưởng và niềm tin, đặc biệt là những ý tưởng thường được chấp nhận

examples: The government's explanation for the budget deficit had more holes than Swiss cheese, and many citizens were left feeling skeptical.

I was skeptical at first, but this Johnathan they hired, truly means business.

words.defineVi: từ chối hoặc đặt câu hỏi về các nguyên lý của một tôn giáo đặc biệt

examples: When you put speakers of mutually unintelligible languages together, they’ll use the elements of their languages to create some basic way of communicating, generally known as a pidgin.
(Son speaking, unintelligible)
And we're from (unintelligible), Ohio. -
My name is Rena, I live in (unintelligible) Mexico , and it's time to spin the Wheel of Mythicality.
If two or more languages aren’t understandable to each other, we say they’re mutually unintelligible.
words.defineEn: poorly articulated or enunciated, or drowned by noise
words.defineVi: phát âm hoặc phát âm kém, hoặc bị át bởi tiếng ồn

words.defineEn: not inhibited or restrained

words.defineVi: không gọn gàng và không chải chuốt

examples: So scientists inferred that the auroras were coming from a bunch of thin ripples in the atmosphere.

words.defineEn: to reach an opinion or decision based on available evidence and deduction

examples: That was an inference that you drew?

examples: She says in several of her articles that judges don't have any obligation to, sua sponte, on their own accord, reconsider precedents, and, for the most part, they have to respond to the arguments made by the litigants.
words.defineEn: (law) a party to a lawsuit; someone involved in litigation
words.defineVi: (luật) bên kiện tụng; ai đó liên quan đến kiện tụng

examples: Edgy litigate really doesn't have a trophy.

This is just one of many issues likely to be litigated before and after Election Day in a number of different states.
words.defineEn: institute legal proceedings against; file a suit against
words.defineVi: khởi kiện chống lại; nộp đơn kiện chống lại

examples: That would be litigious.

words.defineEn: of or relating to litigation
words.defineVi: của hoặc liên quan đến kiện tụng

examples: Inferential statistics allows us to make….inferences.
Inferential statistics let us test an idea or a hypothesis.
We ask inferential statistics to do all sorts of much more complicated work for us.
Inferential statistics allow us to make conclusions that extend beyond the data we have in hand.
Inferential statistics can help us make decisions about data when there’s uncertainty (like whether Smartie-vite actually will increase your IQ).
words.defineEn: relating to or having the nature of illation or inference
words.defineVi: liên quan đến hoặc có bản chất của sự suy luận hoặc suy luận
